Package com.iontrading.mkv

Class MkvEntitlements

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iontrading.mkv.MkvEntitlements
  • @Keep
@KeepPublicClassMemberNames
public class MkvEntitlements
extends Object
    The feature allows users to query Entitlement Server with complex criteria for downloading entire lists of entitlements at once.
    User application can build complex queries by using the exported API for formatting a generic document that describes the pertinent Service/Feature information for which entitlement checking is required.

    The Service/Feature document is a structured information that will be sent onto the ION Bus and is used by the platform Entitlement Server or, for more complex scenarios, can be further filtered and modified by a custom component implementing additional business logics on top of the Entitlement Server.

    The API also provides users with functions to invoke the entitlement checking resolution for the query. This interface for querying is designed after the existing interface for communicating with the Entitlement Server and resolve simple entitlement checks.
    The Service/Feature information for which the user requires the entitlement checking is a flexible structure containing: - A list of services, identified as usual by a tuple of ServiceType, ServiceSource, ServiceContainer and ServiceObject - A list of features, identified as usual by a tree-like string, representing the actions for which entitlements are required: e.g.: Trade/Add, View.

    This structure can be generic, in the sense that service information or feature information can be actual names or can be left as wildcards by the user application, e.g. specifying the '*' character for matching all Sources in a domain.

    In addition to this basic structure, the Service/Feature information can be enhanced by users specifying custom attributes for each element of a service, e.g. to provide business-dependent matching criteria or additional filters that a custom component can use for its own purpose, when evaluating the request.



    Code Sample: 

     MkvEntitlements.Query q = new MkvEntitlements.Query(false);
 MkvEntitlements.Element srv, cont, obj;
 
 srv = q.addService("TradeServer", "TradeServerNY");
 
 cont = q.addContainer(srv, "Books");
 q.setElementAttribute(cont, "Filter", "20Y");
 obj = q.addObject(cont, "Book1");
 obj = q.addObject(cont, "Book2");
 
 cont = q.addContainer(srv, "Goovies");
 obj = q.addObject(cont, "Book1");
 
 q.addFeature(srv, "Trade");
 q.addFeature(srv, "View");
 q.addFeature(srv, "TradeOnBehalfOf");
 
 MkvEntitlements.EntitlementsIterator iter = new MkvEntitlements.EntitlementsIterator(q);
 while (iter.hasNext()) {
     MkvEntitlements.Element curr[] = (MkvEntitlements.Element[]) iter.next();
     System.out.println("Current Element: Service=" + curr[0] + " Container=" + curr[1] + " Object=" + curr[2] + " Feature=" + curr[3]);
 
     if (curr[1].getAttribute("Filter") != null)
         System.out.println("\tAttribute: " + i + " " + curr[1].getAttribute("Filter"));
 }
 
 
 q.setUser(user);
 q.setEntSource(entitlementServerSource);
 q.setPopulate(true); // if you want to store results into the local cache, for subsequent retrieval
 mkv.getEntitlementManager().eval(q, new UserQueryCompletionHandler());



    Completion Handler example: 

     class QueryClosure implements MkvEntitlementsQueryExecuteListener {
     public void onQueryExecuted(MkvEntitlements.Query query, MkvEntitlementPermission permission, MkvEntitlements.EntitlementsIterator iterator) {
         if (permission.intValue() == MkvEntitlementPermission.ALLOW_code) {
             System.out.println("Allowed:");
 
             while (iterator.hasNext()) {
                 MkvEntitlements.Element curr[] = (MkvEntitlements.Element[]) iterator.next();
                 System.out.println("Entitled Element: " + curr[0] + "." + curr[1] + "." + curr[2] + " - Feature=" + curr[3]);
             }
         } else
             System.out.println("DENY! [" + permission.toString() + "]");
     }
 }

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  MkvEntitlements.CommonData
      The common data class
      This class abstracts the common features of a query/response
      static class  MkvEntitlements.Element
      Generic element of a query/response
      This class represents the anchestor of any Service/Container/Object created for entitlements query or response
      static class  MkvEntitlements.EntitlementsIterator
      The entiterator class This class allows both client-side and server-side to iterate over a query/response It can be created using a Query object (for server-side usage) or using a Response object (for client-side usage) The class implements the Iterator interface
      static class  MkvEntitlements.Query
      The query class
      This class contains all the information required to perform a query to the Entitlement Server
      static class  MkvEntitlements.Response
      The response class This class contains all the information that are returned by the Entitlement Server as result of a query Each element is an object for which the user possesses the entitlement
